channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report E-2024110553
item.description:
Report E-2024110553

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-28T06:19:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately twenty (20) ounces of material released from two (2) 2-gallon plastic pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being damaged. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Onsite personnel gathered the spent waste and materials used to clean up the affected area of the trailer and characterized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110461
item.description:
Report E-2024110461

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4806
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver was delivering Xylenes Solution into the customer's storage tank when the delivery hose ruptured. This allowed approximately 3 gallons of product to be released. Ex Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
